stories.title: Why Do Nigerian Scammers Say They Are from Nigeria?
What It’s Like to Stop Using Google Search

stories.text:
I always try to buy "less, but better". The longer I own something, the less clutter I produce and the more money I save.

Here is how I research my products:

- Researching on r/BuyItForLife and the niche subreddit for the product category

- Checking the warranty and repair service

- Reading neutral/negative Reviews. Tear-down videos on Youtube are great too.

How are you researching good products?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you find durable high-quality products online?

The U.S. and NATO must fight
Show HN: Android Contacts API – Built with 3 years of dedication

stories.text:
There are keyboard threads and keyboard posts and new ideas around keyboards all the time, but I have yet to see a single one that adjusts based on the actual measurements of people’s hands.

Especially tall/wide people. I’m 6’1 and feel cramped when using various keyboards. That includes tenting, split, ortholinear, and all the rest of the buzz-words.

It must be even more challenging for people who are 7’ and up!
stories.title: Ask HN: Where are the ergonomic keyboards makers that consider finger length?
